Key Match Events: Bowden Francis' no-hit bid was broken in the ninth inning by Francisco Lindor's solo home run.
Pete Alonso's sacrifice fly brought in the go-ahead run.
Starling Marte and Francisco Alvarez each hit a sacrifice fly to score runs.
Francisco Lindor hit a three-run homer that gave the Mets plenty of cushion.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets avoided a no-hit game, which was a significant event for the team.
Manager Carlos Mendoza praised Francisco Lindor's performance and called him an MVP.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The Mets moved a game ahead of the Braves in the race for the NL's third wild card.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Francisco Lindor wore a special multi-colored glove in honor of the 9/11 first responders.
The Mets haven't been no-hit since October 3, 2015.
